translated: The Questions of King Milinda🔽The Section on Mindfulness

analyzed: bhante nāgasena buddhaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, is the Buddha omniscient and all-seeing?”

analyzed: āma mahā rāja bhagavā sabbaññū sabba dassāvī iti
translated: “Yes, sire, the Blessed One is omniscient and all-seeing.”

original: “Atha kissa nu kho, bhante nāgasena, sāvakānaṁ anupubbena sikkhāpadaṁ paññapesī”ti?
analyzed: atha kissa nu kho bhante nāgasena sāvakānam anupubbena sikkhāpadam paññapesi iti
translated: “Then why, revered sir, did he announce the training rules gradually for his disciples?”

original: “Atthi pana te, mahārāja, koci vejjo, yo imissaṁ pathaviyaṁ sabbabhesajjāni jānātī”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana te mahā rāja koci vejjaḥ yaḥ imissam pathaviyam sabba bhesajjāni jānāti iti
translated: “Have you, sire, any physician who knows all the medicinal herbs in this earth?”

original: “Āma, bhante, atthī”ti.🔽“Kiṁ nu kho, mahārāja, so vejjo gilānakaṁ sampatte kāle bhesajjaṁ pāyeti, udāhu asampatte kāle”ti?
analyzed: āma bhante atthi iti  kim nu khalu mahā rāja saḥ vejjaḥ gilānakam sampatte kāle bhesajjam pāya iti udāhu a sampatte kāla iti
translated: “Yes, revered sir, I have.”🔽“Does that physician, sire, give medicine to the sick at the right time or at the wrong time?”

original: “Sampatte kāle, bhante, gilānakaṁ bhesajjaṁ pāyeti, no asampatte kāle”ti?
analyzed: sampatte kāle bhante gilānakam bhesajjam pāya iti no a sampatte kāla iti
translated: “He gives medicine to the sick, revered sir, at the right time, not at the wrong time.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, bhagavā sabbaññū sabbadassāvī na asampatte kāle sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññāpeti, sampatte kāle sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññāpeti yāvajīvaṁ anatikkamanīyan”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bhagavā sabbaññū sabba dassāvī na a sampatte kāle sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññāpeti sampatte kāle sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññāpeti yāvajīvam an atikkamanīyanti
translated: “Even so, sire, the Blessed One, all-knowing, all-seeing, does not lay down a training precept for his disciples until the time is ripe, and when the time is ripe he lays down a training precept for his disciples which they are not to transgress as long as they live.”
